name: Men of War: Vietnam
description: The critically acclaimed series returns! Experience Vietnam from both sides of the war.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP(SP1), Windows Vista or Windows 7 Processor: P4 2.6GHz (Athlon 3000+) Memory: 1GB Hard Disk Space: 3 GB free hard disk space Video Card: GeForce 6600 (Radeon 1950) 128Mb CD ROM: PC DVD-ROM
recommended_requirements: Processor: Core 2 Duo 2.33GHz (Athlon X2 5000+) Memory: 2GB Video Card: GeForce FX 8800 (Radeon HD3850) 256Mb

reviews.review_text: MOW Vietnam is a good, stable solid game. The mechanics of play are solid enough and the UI is basically same as the other in the series. What makes this game interesting, is playing in the Vietnam War era. Not many games touch on this time and more should. So, at least for now, its a unique game that does a better than fair job in giving you the feeling of fightiing in that era. Have fun!

I dont even know...   I have been a huge fan of the series since the original Men of War came out, but this change my perspective on life. Pros: -Better graphics (Somewhat) -Set in vietnam -Tanks and helcopters Cons: -Voice acting makes you suicidal -Very little units -Cant even use the helecopters -You have like one tank  Its so bad I dont even want to talk about it anymore.  This game almost made me lose faith in the series completely, until I learned it was made by someone else. I had so much hope and so much potential for this game... They luer you in with false trailers and visuals then ♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ you with their giant in-complete ♥♥♥♥.  Please: If you are a fan of this series, DONT BUY IT. I still joke about this game today because it was the WORST game I have ever played.

Must admit really enjoying this game, it's game play is different to most games, it's all about tactics. Yes this game is hard but it's so pleasing when you do win a round, save as many times as you can your squad is wiped just reload and try a new tactic thats the way you win, keep trying, keep trying new tactics. This game has been a breath of fresh air it has really tested the way I approach playing this game and it will do to you too ......... just don't give up, it is a tactical stratagy game and it will frustrate you but when you win what a win, would only recomend to the die hard vietnam game fan boy or the hard core stratagy gamer or the gamer who likes stratagy games but wants a REAL challenge. Not regretted buying it, been great fun and loving everyminute.

They have failed with this game. It is poorly put together missions, with quickly gathered music. Missions have almost no freedom of action. 'Do this or else you fail' The difficulty is put to the extreme, mixed with the horrible level design make this game unplayable. If you are searching reviews whether to buy this game or not. Please buy Men of War: Assault Squad. Because this Vietnam era game has me yelling 'What the F*** is this??' To my computer.

I actually got this off a friend to help him review the game. I have never played any of the other Men of War games. I played it in Multiplayer with him through a few levels. First thing I noticed was the  - absolutely horrible voice acting.  - No tutorials. Normally I don't care about that but how are you supposed to know you are supposed to fix a vehicle without ever indicating it? Didn't even know you could - The gameplay was slow and boring - There was no sense of satisfaction for me in anything  On a good note, there were no lags at all. And... Well.... No, I ain't got nothing, I really dislike this game. It's a good thing I got it free.   Mind you though it might just not be my type of game. For example I really enjoyed the original 2 Fallout games but I didn't like Fallout Tactics.

As all men of war games: Awesome... it has a bit of a learning curve for those that aren't used to the series, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks.. These games are for those that like games like Company of Heroes, but wanted more control and options..

Main menu is cool. BEWARE: Does NOT include a real Multiplayer mode as steam leads you believe. Since co-op with another player is ALWAYS multiplayer (multiple players), this game is tagged for 'Multiplayer' in steam. In reality, not so much. Co-op only. Only two real playable sides here, too. Missions are very difficult and very linear (cant proceed to another objective, even if you know what you're doing). If you're looking for a complete Men of War experience, you want Assault Squad.
